compliant.section: We do not knowingly collect data from or market to children under 18 years of age.
compliant.legal provisions: Conditions applicable to child's consent in relation to information society services

compliant.section: If we learn that personal information from users less than 18 years of age has been collected, we will deactivate the account and take reasonable measures to promptly delete such data from our records.
compliant.legal provisions: Conditions applicable to child's consent in relation to information society services

compliant.section: You may review, change, or terminate your account at any time.
compliant.legal provisions: Transparent information, communication and modalities for the exercise of the data subject's rights, Right of access by the data subject

compliant.section: If you are a resident in the European Economic Area and you believe we are unlawfully processing your personal information, you also have the right to complain to your local data protection supervisory authority.
compliant.legal provisions: Right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority

compliant.section: We have configured our 3rd party cookies to anonymize any Personal Identifiable Information prior to the transmission of the 3rd party data.
compliant.legal provisions: Data protection by design and by default

non_compliant.section: By using the Website, you represent that you are at least 18 or that you are the parent or guardian of such a minor and consent to such minor dependent’s use of the Website.
non_compliant.legal provisions: Conditions applicable to child's consent in relation to information society services
non_compliant.amend: The age of consent for data processing in the EU can vary between 13 and 16. The policy should reflect the specific age of consent for the region in which it applies. Additionally, the language should be clearer about obtaining verifiable parental consent for users under the age of consent.

non_compliant.section: At this stage no uniform technology standard for recognizing and implementing DNT signals has been finalized. As such, we do not currently respond to DNT browser signals or any other mechanism that automatically communicates your choice not to be tracked online.
non_compliant.amend: While there is no uniform standard, the GDPR emphasizes respecting user choice and providing options for objecting to tracking. The policy should explain alternative options for users to manage their tracking preferences, such as cookie controls or opting out of specific tracking technologies.

non_compliant.section: California Civil Code Section 1798.83, also known as the “Shine The Light” law, permits our users who are California residents to request and obtain from us, once a year and free of charge, information about categories of personal information (if any) we disclosed to third parties for direct marketing purposes and the names and addresses of all third parties with which we shared personal information in the immediately preceding calendar year.
non_compliant.legal provisions: Right of access by the data subject, Right to rectification
non_compliant.amend: While similar, the California law's scope is narrower than the GDPR's. The policy should provide all rights granted under GDPR to EEA residents, including the right to access, rectification, erasure, restriction of processing, and data portability, regardless of their location.
